meanings.definition: A spar extending forward from the bow of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The jibboom on the ship helps support the front sail.
meanings.sent2: The sailors secured the jibboom to the bow of the vessel.
meanings.sent3: The seagull perched on the jibboom, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: The jibboom reached out like an arm, guiding the ship through the waves.
meanings.sent5: The jibboom stood tall against the blue sky, a symbol of maritime adventure.

meanings.definition: To shift a sail or boom to the opposite side of a vessel.
meanings.sent1: The crew needed to jibboom the sail quickly to catch the wind.
meanings.sent2: They jibboom the boom to adjust the ship's direction.
meanings.sent3: As the wind changed, they had to jibboom the sail back and forth.
meanings.sent4: The captain yelled to jibboom the sail as they turned sharply.
meanings.sent5: With a swift movement, they jibboom the boom, changing course smoothly.
